intro: Michelia fulva var. calcicola, commonly known as the limestone michelia, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions with limestone-rich soils. It belongs to the Magnoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous habitats, showcasing its adaptation to alkaline conditions. Its leaves are broad and glossy, and it produces small, elongated fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
